info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 5 at 1:25PM MDT until July 5 at 2:45PM MDT by NWS Denver CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, southeastern Larimer.
* WHEN...Until 245 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 122 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This may cause small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen.
- This includes the following streams and drainages... Indian Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Cedar Creek and Dry Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cedar Cove, the Alexander Mountain burn area and the southeast corner of the Cameron Peak burn area. Most of this rain will fall in the Cedar Creek drainage.
info.instruction:
Excessive runoff from this storm will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts.
Rock slides and minor debris flows are likely from this rainfall.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
